tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditional - Finished T123 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament
tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Finished 14th on the final PGA TOUR China Series' Order of Merit but missed a chance to move up by skipping the final three events of the season after playing eight of the first nine. Picked up conditional status on the Ping An Bank China Tour – PGA TOUR China Series by finishing T22 at the First Global Qualifying Tournament in January in Shenzhen…After earning his Ping An Bank - PGA TOUR China playing privileges, played in the Oates Victorian Open, finishing in 20th place on the PGA Tour of Australasia. In his second Ping An Bank - PGA TOUR China Series' start, earned his first top-10 with back-to-back 70s on the weekend at the United Investment Real Estate Wuhan Open...Finished T5 with Alex Hawley, amateur Zihan She and T.K. Kim…Finished T9 at the Lanhai Open in late-May for his second consecutive top-10 of his Ping An Bank China Tour – PGA TOUR China Series' season…Fired a third-round, 6-under 66 at the Cadillac Championship in mid-September and then followed it with a 69 Sunday to earn his third top-10 of the campaign, a T10 with Xinjun Zhang, Sejun Yoon and Jin Zhang...Two weeks later, was third again, this time at the Chongqing Jiangnan NewTown KingRun Open. Started slowly and was 1-over through 36 holes. Picked up the pace Saturday, moving from a tie for 18th when the day began into a tie for seventh after a 5-under 67. Improved by a stroke a day later, shooting a 6-under 66—including four consecutive birdies on Nos. 3-6—to finish five shots behind winner Xinjun Zhang. Improved to seventh on the Order of Merit with three tournaments remaining on the schedule. 

2014: Best PGA Tour of Australasia finish was a T58 at the New South Wales Open. 2013: Top outing of the campaign was a T54 at the Queensland Open in August. 2012: In his lone PGA Tour of Australasia start, finished T16 at the BMW New Zealand Open, thanks to closing rounds of 71-70.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Former New Zealand Golf Representative...Claimed his maiden national title in 2012 when when he won the North Island Stroke Play Championship.
tourBios.personal: Attended Ashburton High School in Ashburton, New Zealand...Wife, Sarah, is a New Zealand Representative Sprinter..Worked as a dairy farmer and timber yard worker after college...If he was not playing golf for a living, he would like to be a farmer...Biggest thrill outside golf is shooting a stag.

tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Finished 14th on the final PGA TOUR China Series' Order of Merit but missed a chance to move up by skipping the final three events of the season after playing eight of the first nine. Picked up conditional status on the Ping An Bank China Tour – PGA TOUR China Series by finishing T22 at the First Global Qualifying Tournament in January in Shenzhen...After earning his Ping An Bank - PGA TOUR China playing privileges, played in the Oates Victorian Open, finishing in 20th place on the PGA Tour of Australasia. In his second Ping An Bank - PGA TOUR China Series' start, earned his first top-10 with back-to-back 70s on the weekend at the United Investment Real Estate Wuhan Open...Finished T5 with Alex Hawley, amateur Zihan She and T.K. Kim...Finished T9 at the Lanhai Open in late-May for his second consecutive top-10 of his Ping An Bank China Tour – PGA TOUR China Series' season...Fired a third-round, 6-under 66 at the Cadillac Championship in mid-September and then followed it with a 69 Sunday to earn his third top-10 of the campaign, a T10 with Xinjun Zhang, Sejun Yoon and Jin Zhang...Two weeks later, was third again, this time at the Chongqing Jiangnan NewTown KingRun Open. Started slowly and was 1-over through 36 holes. Picked up the pace Saturday, moving from a tie for 18th when the day began into a tie for seventh after a 5-under 67. Improved by a stroke a day later, shooting a 6-under 66—including four consecutive birdies on Nos. 3-6—to finish five shots behind winner Xinjun Zhang. Improved to seventh on the Order of Merit with three tournaments remaining on the schedule. 

2014: Best PGA Tour of Australasia finish was a T58 at the New South Wales Open.  
2013: Top outing of the campaign was a T54 at the Queensland Open in August. Finished inside the top 10 on the New Zealand PGA Order of Merit.
2012: In his lone PGA Tour of Australasia start, finished T16 at the BMW New Zealand Open, thanks to closing rounds of 71-70.

dyn.dynResults: He has finished 3rd on the PGA Tour China Serie 2 times.
